required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Serial OCT Evaluation of Tissue Coverage in Patients Submitted to Inspiron Drug Eluting Stent Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: Serial OCT Evaluation of Tissue Coverage in Patients Submitted to Inspiron Drug Eluting Stent Implantation

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, multicentric, single-arm study to evaluate fast and effective tissue repair in patients undergone percutaneous coronary intervention with drug eluting stent Inspiron.

detailed_description.textblock:
The first 20 patients enrolled will be evaluated by angiography and Optical Coherence Tomography 3 months after stent implantation. The following 20 patients will be evaluated by the same methods 2 months after the implantation and the last 20 patients after 30 days.
All patients will be clinically followed at 30 days, 6 months, 1 and 2 years after index procedure.

primary_outcome.description: Change in the tissue coverage percentage measured by OCT

secondary_outcome.description: Target Vessel Failure (Death, MI and new revascularization)

arm_group.description: Angiography and Optical Coherence Tomography evaluations
Angiography and Optical Coherence Tomography evaluations
Angiography and Optical Coherence Tomography evaluations

intervention.intervention_name: Angiography and Optical Coherence Tomography evaluations
intervention.description: coronary stent implantation followed by Angiography and Optical Coherence Tomography evaluations

facility.name: Instituto de Cardiologia do Rio Grande do Sul

clinical_study.keyword: stent, DES, INSPIRON, OCT, tissue repair
